Which of the following faults precludes the car from being safely used on the road?
examQuestions32.a: Contaminated air filter insert.
examQuestions32.b: Heating up electrodes of spark-plugs.
examQuestions32.c: Burnt out light bulb of the left rear indicator.

examQuestions32.text: How is a national driving licence retained during a roadside inspection by a competent authority?
examQuestions32.a: By entering details of the retention in the Central Register of Drivers and informing them if they do not have a document with them.
examQuestions32.b: By introducing information on the retention of the driving licence into the Central Register of Drivers and issue of an retention receipt to the driver.
examQuestions32.c: By retaining the driving licence and entering information on the retention of the driving licence into the Central Register of Drivers.

examQuestions32.text: Which of these mentioned documents is the driver of a vehicle registered in the territory of the Republic of Poland obliged to carry and present at the request of a competent authority?
examQuestions32.a: National driving licence
examQuestions32.b: Vehicle registration document
examQuestions32.c: A document other than a national driving licence which certifies the authorisation to drive the vehicle.

examQuestions32.text: What failure is indicated by a rapidly flashing turn signal?
examQuestions32.a: Weak battery.
examQuestions32.b: Short circuit in high voltage wires.
examQuestions32.c: Burnt-out turn signal bulb.

examQuestions32.text: In what order should you perform the following activities when preparing to drive a vehicle?
examQuestions32.a: Fasten the seat belts, position the mirrors and the driver's seat.
examQuestions32.b: Position the mirrors, the driver's seat and fasten the seat belts.
examQuestions32.c: Position the driver's seat, mirrors and fasten the seat belts.

examQuestions32.text: What is the purpose of using the ESP system in a passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: Preventing skidding of the wheels while engine braking.
examQuestions32.b: Preventing blocking of the braked wheels.
examQuestions32.c: Stabilizing the movement of the vehicle when driving along the curve.

examQuestions32.text: Is it allowed to carry a child up to the age of three years in a lorry equipped with seatbelts and a safety seat?
examQuestions32.a: No - children under three years of age can only be transported without seat belts on buses.
examQuestions32.b: Yes, it is permitted.
examQuestions32.c: No - a child under three years of age can only be transported unfastened to the seatbelt in a taxi.

examQuestions32.text: What documents are you obliged to carry with you and present at the request of a competent authority when driving a vehicle registered abroad in the territory of the Republic of Poland?
examQuestions32.a: Proof of vehicle ownership.
examQuestions32.b: Document confirming the conclusion of a compulsory civil liability insurance contract by the vehicle owner.
examQuestions32.c: A document confirming payment of the stamp duty.

examQuestions32.text: What documents must you carry with you and present at the request of a competent authority when driving a vehicle registered abroad in the territory of the Republic of Poland?
examQuestions32.a: A document certifying that the vehicle is roadworthy.
examQuestions32.b: A document confirming the conclusion of an accident insurance policy.
examQuestions32.c: Copy of a certificate attesting to the completion of a technical inspection.

examQuestions32.text: What will a police officer do if, during a roadside inspection,it is established that you have exceeded the speed limit by more than 50 km/h in a built-up area, but this was done in order to save someone's life?
examQuestions32.a: Withhold your driving licence.
examQuestions32.b: Caution and refer you to take a control exam.
examQuestions32.c: Will not withhold your driving licence.

examQuestions32.text: Which of these driving techniques applies to the term "eco-driving"?
examQuestions32.a: Using only the service brake to reduce speed.
examQuestions32.b: Using the engine to reduce driving speed.
examQuestions32.c: Changing gears frequently to maintain a high engine revolution.

examQuestions32.c: When disformations are visible on the sides of the tyre.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following ways of braking in a passenger car fitted with the ABS is the most effective?
examQuestions32.a: Pulse pressing of the brake pedal.
examQuestions32.b: Fast and strong pressing of the brake pedal.
examQuestions32.c: Pressing the clutch pedal and then the brake pedal.

examQuestions32.text: What will happen if a police officer discovers during a roadside inspection that you have exceeded the speed limit by more than 50 km/h in a built-up area, but that this was done in order to save somebody's life?
examQuestions32.a: The police officer will withhold your driving licence.
examQuestions32.b: The Police officer will refer you to an instructor for additional training.
examQuestions32.c: The police officer will refrain from retaining your driving licence.

examQuestions32.text: What is the penalty for a lorry driver carrying three persons more than the number of seats stated on the vehicle's registration document?
examQuestions32.a: Retention of driving licence for 3 months.
examQuestions32.b: Retention of driving licence for 3 months and a driver qualification check.
examQuestions32.c: Retention of driving licence for 6 months.

examQuestions32.text: How should you transport cargo in a trailer pulled by a passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: The cargo should not be protected from displacement.
examQuestions32.b: The cargo may block some of the trailer's lights.
examQuestions32.c: The cargo cannot have any effects on the stability of the vehicle.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following actions should you perform when driving a passenger car at night in a fog?
examQuestions32.a: Decrease the speed.
examQuestions32.b: Turn on the high-beam lights in order to improve visibility.
examQuestions32.c: Drive very close to the car in front in order to see its sidelights.

examQuestions32.text: You are driving a passenger vehicle with a trailer on the highway. What speed must you not exceed?
examQuestions32.a: 80 km/h.
examQuestions32.c: 90 km/h.

examQuestions32.text: At what maximum permissible speed can you tow another vehicle?
examQuestions32.a: 50 km/h in built-up areas.
examQuestions32.b: 60 km/h outside built-up areas.
examQuestions32.c: 80 km/h on a dual carriageway road with at least two lanes in each direction.

examQuestions32.a: Yes, but only at a speed above 20 km/h.
examQuestions32.b: Yes.
examQuestions32.c: No, one is enough.

examQuestions32.text: As the owner of a vehicle, are you obliged to indicate at the request of an authorised body to whom you entrusted the vehicle for driving or use at a specific time?
examQuestions32.a: Yes, unless it is a vehicle used for business purposes.
examQuestions32.b: Yes, unless the vehicle was used contrary to your will and without your knowledge by an unknown person, which you could not prevent.
examQuestions32.c: I am not obliged to do so.

examQuestions32.a: Safe distance, less than 1 m.

examQuestions32.c: Not less than 1 m.

examQuestions32.c: On a single carriageway road outside a built-up area.

examQuestions32.a: switching on hazard lights.

examQuestions32.a: Pulse braking.
examQuestions32.b: Pushing the brake pedal all the way down.
examQuestions32.c: Pulling up the handbrake.

examQuestions32.a: Look only in front of you.
examQuestions32.b: Pay the same amount of attention to observing the road in front of and behind the vehicle.
examQuestions32.c: Look to the front and from time to time monitor the road behind the vehicle using the side mirrors.

examQuestions32.a: No, such driving licence is issued by the Starost.
examQuestions32.b: Yes, but you have to pay a registration fee.
examQuestions32.c: Yes, in all cases.

examQuestions32.b: Only if the third child is at least 100 cm tall.
examQuestions32.c: Only if the third child is 15 years old.

examQuestions32.a: The extinguisher is placed on the rear shelf.

examQuestions32.c: The extinguisher is mounted under the passenger seat.

examQuestions32.a: Before the beginning of a journey.
examQuestions32.b: After finishing driving.

examQuestions32.a: Use the engine revolutions maximally in every gear.
examQuestions32.b: Accelerate to such speed in lower gear that after switching to the next gear the vehicle does not jerk and does not choke.
examQuestions32.c: In every case increase the gear by two.

examQuestions32.c: 90 km/h.

examQuestions32.a: So that it does not cover the lights of the trailer.
examQuestions32.b: I will put it only on one side of the trailer.
examQuestions32.c: I will always place it at the rear of the trailer.

examQuestions32.b: 2.6 millimetres.

examQuestions32.a: A short circuit in the turnsignal circuit.
examQuestions32.b: A failure of one of the turnsignal bulbs.
examQuestions32.c: Low battery voltage.

examQuestions32.a: Not covered - placed below the height of the side boards.
examQuestions32.b: Not exceeding the speed of 30 km/h.
examQuestions32.c: Covered in a tight load-carrying platform.

examQuestions32.text: In what circumstance will the driving licence not be withheld for exceeding the speed limit by more than 50 km/h in a built-up area?
examQuestions32.a: If the driver of the vehicle has committed an infringement in order to ward off an imminent danger to an asset protected by law.
examQuestions32.b: If the driver of the vehicle behind uses warning lights and sound signals to indicate a need to increase speed.
examQuestions32.c: If the driver increased speed so as to quickly exit the intersection of roads while the green signal lights are on.

examQuestions32.a: In such a way that its upper part is at the level of the top of the head.

examQuestions32.c: In such a way that its upper part is at the level of the neck.

examQuestions32.text: At what permissible speed are you allowed to travel when driving a passenger car pulling a light trailer on the highway?
examQuestions32.a: 80 km/h.

examQuestions32.c: In all cases, a certificate indicating the car has undergone a technical inspection.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following actions apply to drivers involved in a motor vehicle accident in which there are no fatalities or victims?
examQuestions32.a: Remain at the scene of the accident.
examQuestions32.b: Call the Police.
examQuestions32.c: Remove the vehicle from the scene of the accident so as not to impede traffic.

examQuestions32.a: Increase speed.
examQuestions32.b: Increase the distance between you and the preceding vehicle.

examQuestions32.a: Static - sitting in a stiff position, without moving your body or head.
examQuestions32.b: Dynamic - bending your body and head away from the seat, as required by the circumstances.
examQuestions32.c: Any position - as long as it guarantees comfort of driving.

examQuestions32.a: The battery voltage.
examQuestions32.b: The condition of fuses.
examQuestions32.c: The condition of direction indicator bulbs.

examQuestions32.a: In every well-equipped garage.
examQuestions32.b: In an authorized repair shop that services vehicles.
examQuestions32.c: At a local or regional vehicle inspection station.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following road elements should you observe when driving on the highway?
examQuestions32.a: Only the traffic lane in front of your vehicle.
examQuestions32.b: The entire roadway and hard shoulder in front and behind the vehicle.
examQuestions32.c: Only your traffic lane and the right hard shoulder in front of the vehicle.

examQuestions32.text: At what maximum speed are you allowed to drive on the road beyond these signs if you are hauling another passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: 30 km/h.
examQuestions32.b: 60 km/h.
examQuestions32.c: 90 km/h.

examQuestions32.a: Frequent use of the service brake.
examQuestions32.b: Avoiding sudden braking and acceleration.
examQuestions32.c: Frequent change of gears.

examQuestions32.a: It prevents wheels from skidding when starting off.
examQuestions32.b: It allows the driver to control the vehicle at the time of sudden braking.
examQuestions32.c: It always reduces the braking distance.

examQuestions32.text: What documents are you obliged to carry with you and present at the request of a competent authority when driving a vehicle registered abroad in the territory of the Republic of Poland?
examQuestions32.a: A professional vehicle registration document.
examQuestions32.b: Proof of payment of the premium for the compulsory civil liability insurance.
examQuestions32.c: A document confirming payment for the use of motorways and expressways.

examQuestions32.a: Green.
examQuestions32.b: Yellow.
examQuestions32.c: Red.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following results may you cause when moving off uphill you release the emergency brake lever too early in relation to releasing the clutch pedal?
examQuestions32.a: Arrest of the engine.
examQuestions32.b: Rolling down of the vehicle.
examQuestions32.c: Sudden start.

examQuestions32.text: In what way are you allowed to carry bicycles on a passenger car?
examQuestions32.a: Placed in holders at the rear of the car and limiting the legibility of the registration plate.
examQuestions32.b: Placed in holders at the rear of the car and covering one side light of the car.
examQuestions32.c: Placed in holders fixed on the roof rack.

examQuestions32.text: During which of the following manoeuvres are you obliged to keep a distance not less than 1 metres from the vehicle?
examQuestions32.a: Passing the passenger car.
examQuestions32.b: Overtaking the bicycle.
examQuestions32.c: Passing whichever vehicle.

examQuestions32.text: Under what circumstances is it permitted to carry a child in a lorry with a maximum permissible weight exceeding 3.5 tonnes in the rear seat, restrained only by safety belts?
examQuestions32.a: If the child has reached a height of at least 135 cm and it is not possible to provide a safety seat due to its weight and height.
examQuestions32.b: If the child has reached a height of at least 135 cm regardless of weight.
examQuestions32.c: There is no obligation to carry a child in the rear seat of a lorry in safety seats.

examQuestions32.c: A document confirming the valid obligatory third party civil liability insurance.

examQuestions32.c: By rapidly releasing the clutch pedal.

examQuestions32.c: in a home zone.

examQuestions32.a: Yes, but only after nightfall.
examQuestions32.b: Yes.
examQuestions32.c: No.

examQuestions32.a: For 3 months.
examQuestions32.b: For 6 months.
examQuestions32.c: For 1 month.

examQuestions32.b: When carrying a child in the back seat.
examQuestions32.c: When carrying a child on an adult's lap.

examQuestions32.c: The controller will impose a fine for lack of the required documents.

examQuestions32.c: always left in the vehicle - till the coming of a doctor.

examQuestions32.c: 72 hours.

examQuestions32.c: Safe, that is always the same.

examQuestions32.b: Decrease in vehicle speed.

examQuestions32.c: No, this is prohibited.

examQuestions32.text: What conditions must you meet if you wish to carry a child in the rear seat of a passenger car?

examQuestions32.b: The speed must not exceed 40 km/h.
examQuestions32.c: The child being carried is at least 135 cm tall and is only fastened with seat belts, as the weight and height precludes carriage in a child restraint system.

examQuestions32.b: By gently pressing the braking pedal.
examQuestions32.c: By pressing the braking pedal to the maximum.

examQuestions32.c: It has an effect on limiting the field of vision.

examQuestions32.a: That there is a collision-free passage for wild animals underneath the road.
examQuestions32.b: That wild animals may be running across the road.
examQuestions32.c: That animals may be herded across the road.

examQuestions32.text: How should the external mirrors of the passenger car be positioned?
examQuestions32.a: Such that half of the mirror is visible through the window of the front doors.
examQuestions32.b: Such that the side of the car is not visible in the mirror.
examQuestions32.c: Such that a fragment of the side of the car and and the road behind is visible in the mirror.

examQuestions32.text: What should you do in this situation?
examQuestions32.a: You have the right to change traffic lanes to the left.
examQuestions32.b: You should remain on the traffic lane you are taking.
examQuestions32.c: When changing lanes you need not exercise special caution.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following actions may contribute to an increase in safety level while driving on the road covered with snow?
examQuestions32.a: Braking only with a hand brake.
examQuestions32.b: Using winter tires.
examQuestions32.c: Decided speeding up.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the following lights are you allowed to use when you are driving a passenger car during a fog?
examQuestions32.a: Daytime running lights.
examQuestions32.b: Front fog lights.
examQuestions32.c: High beam lights only.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the control lights visible in the illustration informs you that the main beam lights are enabled?
examQuestions32.a: A.
examQuestions32.b: B.
examQuestions32.c: C.

examQuestions32.text: Which of the control lights visible in the illustration informs you that the rear windscreen heater is enabled?
examQuestions32.a: A.
examQuestions32.b: B.
examQuestions32.c: C.

examQuestions32.text: What should you do if you identify an open fracture?
examQuestions32.a: Apply a cotton dressing.
examQuestions32.b: Immobilize two adjacent joints.
examQuestions32.c: Immediately stretch the limb vigorously.

examQuestions32.text: What should you do in this situation?
examQuestions32.a: You have the right to change traffic lanes to the left.
examQuestions32.b: You should remain on the traffic lane you are taking.
examQuestions32.c: When changing lanes you need not exercise special caution.

examQuestions32.text: At what speed is a passenger car permitted to travel on a motorway?
examQuestions32.a: At a speed of not more than 140 km/h, while maintaining control of the vehicle and taking into account the prevailing traffic conditions.
examQuestions32.b: At a speed of not less than 40 km/h, taking into account the prevailing weather conditions (blizzard, downpour, etc.).
examQuestions32.c: At any speed that ensures control of the vehicle.

examQuestions32.text: After performing a manoeuvre to the right at this intersection, are you obliged  to switch off the indicator?

Are you allowed to stop your vehicle on this bridge, in order to drop off passengers?

Are you allowed to turn left from the lane you are occupying?

Do you have to yield the right of way at the nearest crossroads to all vehicles approaching from the right?

Does the horizontal dotted line visible in this intersection indicate continuation of the traffic lane occupied?
In the presented situation, are you allowed to drive through the railway crossing without stopping?

In the situation presented, does the visible sign warn you of two dangerous bends, the first of which is to the direction indicated on the sign, and the second of which may be to the left or to the right?
On a road, once you go past this sign, can you make a U-turn?
Should you signal the fact of parking a broken-down car on an area excluded from driving?

In this situation, are you obliged to exercise particular caution?

examQuestions32.text: Which of these factors should you take into account when executing an overtaking manoeuvre?
examQuestions32.a: Appropriate temperature inside the vehicle.
examQuestions32.b: Maintaining a safe distance.
examQuestions32.c: Distance of the vehicles behind.

examQuestions32.text: What behaviour increases the risk of skidding on icy road surfaces?
examQuestions32.a: Sudden hard braking.
examQuestions32.b: Engine braking.
examQuestions32.c: Driving at constant speed.

examQuestions32.text: In what way should you brake in an emergency situation, if the vehicle is equipped with anti-lock braking system (ABS)?
examQuestions32.a: Firmly press on the brake pedal without releasing it when the ABS system is activated.
examQuestions32.b: Firmly press on the brake pedal and slightly let up on it while the ABS system is activated.
examQuestions32.c: Press on the brake pedal using a pulsating action until the ABS system is activated.

examQuestions32.text: In which picture is the headrest properly mounted?
examQuestions32.a: A
examQuestions32.b: B
examQuestions32.c: C

examQuestions32.text: What document are you obliged to carry with you and present at the request of a competent authority?
examQuestions32.a: Proof of participation in a pre-qualification training course.
examQuestions32.b: A document certifying the right to drive a vehicle other than a national driving licence.
examQuestions32.c: Document confirming the completion of pre-medical first aid training.

examQuestions32.text: A properly adjusted external mirror on a passenger car shows:
examQuestions32.a: only the space beside the vehicle.
examQuestions32.b: only the space behind the vehicle.
examQuestions32.c: a part of the vehicle side and the space behind it corresponding to the vehicle side.

examQuestions32.text: For which of the following states of the engine should the oil level in the engine be checked?
examQuestions32.a: When the engine is on.
examQuestions32.b: Immediately after the engine is switched off.
examQuestions32.c: Before the cold engine is started or at least a few minutes after switching it off.

examQuestions32.text: What may be the consequences of a driver's failure to fasten their seat belts?
examQuestions32.a: More damage to the car in the event of a collision.
examQuestions32.b: More bodily injuries suffered by the driver in the event of an accident.
examQuestions32.c: Damage to the airbag.

examQuestions32.text: In case of a wound hemorrhage and lack of sterile dressing you should:
examQuestions32.a: put off dressing the wound.
examQuestions32.b: use the clothing of an injured person as dressing.
examQuestions32.c: wait until somebody lends you the first aid kit.

examQuestions32.text: What influence does driving speed have on the vehicle driver's field of vision?
examQuestions32.a: As speed increases, the field of view narrows
examQuestions32.b: As speed increases, the field of view expand
examQuestions32.c: Driving speed has no influence on the driver's field of vision

examQuestions32.text: While driving a car in wintertime and you see a blue, half-conscious, freezing person on the shoulder, how should you help him?
examQuestions32.a: Give him a hot drink.
examQuestions32.b: Give him alcohol.
examQuestions32.c: Take him to the car, cover him and have him warm up slowly.
